function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of wastewater to detect pathogenic organisms may lead to misinterpretation of disease prevalence in the community.","Impact":"Misinforming public health measures and resource allocation for disease control and prevention.","Mitigation":"Validation of findings through clinical data and cross-referencing with traditional disease surveillance methods.","Technologies":"Advanced sequencing and analysis techniques for accurate identification of pathogens in wastewater.","People":"Public health authorities, community members.","Owner":"Public health authorities, researchers."},{"Description":"High mutation rates of RNA viruses may lead to rapid adaptation and spread in new host populations.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease outbreaks and difficulty in developing effective vaccines and treatments.","Mitigation":"Active surveillance of viral mutations, development of broad-spectrum antiviral drugs, and implementation of strict infection control measures.","Technologies":"Genomic sequencing and bioinformatics tools for tracking viral mutations.","People":"Public health authorities, healthcare workers, researchers.","Owner":"Public health authorities, pharmaceutical companies."},{"Description":"Historical data from wastewater surveillance may not accurately predict future disease outbreaks.","Impact":"Limited effectiveness in preemptive public health interventions and response planning.","Mitigation":"Integration of wastewater surveillance with real-time clinical data, epidemiological modeling, and public health intelligence.","Technologies":"Big data analytics, machine learning for predictive modeling, and real-time data integration platforms.","People":"Public health authorities, epidemiologists, researchers.","Owner":"Public health authorities, research institutions."}]}
